page.title: 20 - CHANGE OF BUILDING USE
page.content:
Coates castle was built in 1820 by Lord Egremont. The Duchess of Abercorn lived there for 20 years until her death in 1905. During the second war war a secret research unit occupied it while developing the Becklar bombardment. The castle has since been altered to form eight flats. Burton Park House was built in 1825 by Henry Bassett. The main staircase was brought from Michael Grove, Arundel in 1829. For many years the Courtauld family lived there, including Major J.S.Courtauld who was MP for Chichester. In 1946 St.Michael's School moved there from Bognor Regis, and it has remained as a private girls school since that time.
This text was compiled by MERIEL FOOKS, DUNCTON.
